alert.note: Alert for Putnam (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 9:16PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Putnam County through 945 PM EDT... At 916 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Eatonton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Eatonton, Phoenix, Rockville, Rock Eagle 4-H Center, Central Georgia Experiment Stn, Plant Harlee Branch, Resseaus Crossroads, Oconee Springs Park, Stanfordville, Warfield and Willard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
